metadata.synopsis: The players are woken up by the booming voice of the Absolute becoming unbearable. The artefact struggles and eventually shines bright, opening a portal (seen in gameplay) to the Astral Plane. GROUP_Players in SpeakerGroup1 is the active player.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go to sleep during the ArriveIntermezzo camp night.

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *The events of the last days weigh heavily upon you. Sleep's rest is slow to come to one whose mind is so full.*
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lying down in bedroll, contemplating while trying to fall asleep.

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *The Absolute is not a god, but an elder brain controlled by the Chosen of the Dead Three. They mean to use it to take control of the Sword Coast.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *All who carry the tadpole are governed by the brain, and by extension, the Chosen. It will take but one order to transform them into an army of mind flayers.*

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *This would have been your fate too, were it not for the Astral Prism and the mysterious visitor inside of it.*

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *This would have been your fate too, were it not for the dream visitor's protection.*

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *The very same visitor who Vlaakith seems so eager to kill - and Voss seems so eager to free.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *The very same visitor who Vlaakith seems so eager to kill.*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *With their help, you have uncovered the cult for what it really is - a plan of conquest orchestrated by the gods of death themselves.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *Together, you have the power to thwart the Dead Three. If you follow this path to its end, the elder brain will not answer to the Chosen. It will answer to you.*

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *A heavy burden indeed. After all, the artefact that protects you came from your own people. What role have they to play in this plane's existence?*

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *Lady Shar sent you on this mission - did she know that this is where it would lead?*

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *And when you complete it, what will you do then?*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *That you remain alive is a failure to Mystra. But if you were to lay hands on that Crown... might she have reason to forgive you then? Would you even need her forgiveness?*

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *And what of the True Souls? Will you liberate them from their parasites and religious delusions? Or will you use the power for your own gain?*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *If the dream visitor speaks true, then the entire Sword Coast is under threat. It will take a true hero to save it. But is that really you?*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *You who are a plaything for a cambion.*

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *You who bear the face of a devil.*

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *You will finally have the chance to destroy Gortash. But what then? What fires will still burn in you when he is extinguished?*

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *You know servitude better than anyone - you have been denied freedom for nearly two centuries, and are denied it still.*

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *You are hungry beyond blood, beyond lust, beyond your unliving life itself.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *And what then? You are prone to impulses as uncontrollable as the gods themselves. Will you even have a say in what you do?*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Will you liberate the True Souls from their parasites and their religious delusions? Or will you use the power you gain for your own purposes?*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *And what of your father? Will you tear him away from the elder brain's clutches, or allow him to suffer?*

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I've witnessed the Heart of the Absolute. I'm going the learn the secrets of that crown...

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I will continue in Lady Shar's service. She will never know a more loyal follower. Nor a stronger one.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: First, Gortash. Then, the rest of my life.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: First, I will save my father. Nothing else matters right now.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I will have my vengeance. Cazador will be dust.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I will fulfil my duty to my queen. I will ascend!

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I will do as Voss asked. I will protect the Astral Prism and free the one inside.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I will reap a savage fate on this world unlike any that has ever been seen.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *Your blood swims hot at the very prospect.*

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I will find a way to rid myself of these disturbing impulses.

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Even as you utter the words to yourself, you know it is but an intention. And these dark desires of yours have little regard for your intentions.*

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *You will not have long to wait. All you need to do now is sleep...*
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player begins to fall asleep.

48.speaker: Narrator
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is abruptly woken up by the pain in their head from the booming voice of the Absolute.

12.text: Hear me. Gather. The reckoning is upon us.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Booming sounds of the voice of the Absolute throughout this dialogue and into gameplay. Player awakes suddenly, clutching their head in pain, rolling on the ground.

51.context: CinematicNodeContext: The artefact levitates into the air, glowing shaking, rattling, as if fighting something. The player reaches for it but can't lift themself off the ground.

21.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The cracks in the artefact light up, shafts of light splintering out of it, blinding the player as a portal forms. 

Some of Orpheus' githyanki guard appear out of the portal, braced for combat.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: All I want is to be free of this parasite. I will do what is necessary to make that happen.

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *Right now, your resolve feels firm. But there is no knowing how you will feel when the moment comes.*

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I will succeed where the Chosen will fail. I will dominate the world.

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *A thrill courses through you at the thought.*

5.speaker: Player
5.text: When the moment comes, I'll do what feels right.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I will free everyone of this evil - I will be the hero that saves Baldur's Gate.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I will heed my companions' needs - I would not have made it this far without them.

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *Will you liberate them from their parasites and their religious delusions? Or will you use the power you gain for your own purposes?*
